column1: Provide a complete list of tested and omitted effects

column3: If region is based on the same data, clarify how circularity was accounted for.

If reporting R^2 (coefficient of determination) clarify how nuisance variability is considered. For instance, in task fMRI the vast majority of variance is explained by slow temporal drift, and R^2 values for an effect of interest will be vastly different if computed with or without counting drift in the total variance
State whether data extracted from an ROI (e.g. to compute an effect size) is defined based on independent data, as otherwise it is susceptible to bias
If ROIs are circularly defined, best not to provide any statistical summary (i.e. p-values, R^2, etc.)
contrast and effect to which it refers
clarify whether peak or center-of-­mass location
Anatomical region (in caption or body text, describe source of labels, e.g. subjective, atlas, etc.)

column6: voxel­-wise FWE corrected | voxel­-wise FDR corrected | voxel­-wise FWE uncorrected | cluster-wise FWE corrected | cluster-wise FDR corrected | cluster-wise FWE uncorrected | TFCE | other

column3: with degrees of freedom in table caption
column27: important for coordinate based meta-analysis using SDM

column3: In caption, state whether coordinates are from whole brain, or from a specific constrained volume
If cluster­wise inference is used. Report in mm3 or, if in voxels, be explicit about the size of voxels. If a cluster statistic other than size is used (e.g. mass) it should be listed as well
In caption or body text, note criterion for peak per cluster reporting; e.g. “one peak per cluster listed”, or “up to 3 per cluster that are at least 8mm apart” (SPM default), etc.
as well as form of any sub-volume corrections applied when computing corrected significance
column6: Familywise Error: Random Field Theory; Familywise Error: Permutation; Familywise Error: Monte Carlo; Familywise Error: Bonferroni | False Discovery Rate: Benjamini and Hochberg | False Discovery Rate: Positive FDR | False Discovery Rate: Local FDR | False Discovery Rate: Cluster-level FDR | None/Uncorrected

column15: Unthresholded maps (Share via supplementary material or repository)
column27: useful for future meta-analysis based on these maps

column15: Unthresholded maps (Share via supplementary material or repository)

column3: For example % BOLD change, % GM change...
column15: Unthresholded maps (Share via supplementary material or repository)

column1: Size of the analysis volume in voxels

column3: This is the estimated smoothness used with Random Field Theory or a simulation-based inference method.

column1: For connectivty ICA based methods, report the total number of components (especially when estimated from the data and not fixed). Report the number of these analyzed and the reason for their selection
For connectivty graph-based methods, carefully state what is the null hypothesis of the test and how the statistic distribution under the null is computed
For multivariate, report optimised evaluation metrics
column3: Report the values obtained for the evaluation metrics chosen, as well as any Pp values to justify above­-chance performance.
